One of the people I have met along the way during my most recent and most successful stretch of clean time asked me this simple question:
"How long were you using for?"
Upon my answer of eight years, he replied: "You have to be realistic with yourself. Do you think you can be back where you want to be in one month after eight years of using? Exactly."
I encourage anyone who wants to make that change to realize that you already do know, in your heart, that you are fully capable of changing.

I got one to help cope with withdrawal and chip off Heroin, because for some reason I don't feel a craving for Oxy like I do with Heroin and as long as I do a tiny bit of opiate I can usually endure any remaining w/d symptoms.
Is the dope boy the first guy you call?
What finally did it for you? What was it that kept you away during the PAWS?
Have any of you ever withdrew from both benzos and opiates before? I was taking 8mg clonazepam for 2 full years daily (RX'd) and probably 80-100mg oxycodone a day and cut both cold turkey once.
Is it because fent/the analogs have such short halflife?
Does anyone else have something like this? An s/o? A friend? Family member?
Does anyone have any experience with this?
hypothetically, say i took my last perc 10 at 1am tonight, if i woke up at 10-11am the next day, would .25-.5mg of suboxone still throw me into PWD?
Can't beleive I'm typeing this, but also looking for best ROA for the morphine and opanas other than IV.
I just acquired 3 OP40s and was wondering if the same process can be applied without the microfreezing and all that jazz.  Curious of other peoples experience using a dremel on these bad boys.
So I have a decent tolerance, can take 200mg of "op" oxys and be cool.
Update to the best opiates in the worst form post... (Cross-section of the Exalgo and the powder for the dremeled Opana)
Do you guys think the stop was bullshit so that's why they let it go?  I personally think it's because they are harassing my friend and now they are 0-2 on trying to pop him.
All these horror stories about Sub w/d is making me concerned

I've attempted to admit myself to the psyciatric institute a couple years ago, was triaged and then  essentailly laughed at becuase I wasn't a threat because I wasn't suicidal. I have you ever tried to get help and was told to essentailly F off? Yea, I can't keep a steady job, I go to school, I am broke.
I have some sub's I can take so that should help buy still need to wait another 12 hour before I can take it.
I was in hardcore, white knuckle, cold turkey withdrawal(puking, shitting, cold sweats, can't get comfortable, etc).
I mean at this point I've used everyday for a week and now get withdrawals again.
How do you guys deal with the fallout from the huge life change that is of a recovering addict?
I have no motivation and I feel lost. Who am I? I was an addict for so long thats who I've become.
I hear the depression lasts month. I really dont know how I can handle that much misery if its true.
How the hell do I do this? If this is sobriety, I don't know if I'm up for it.
Am I seriously in gabapentin withdrawl? Or is it just opiate PAWS?
am I seriously in gabapentin withdrawl or is this opiate paws?
what the fuck man. This shit is such a nasty cycle.
Anyone else get these? When can I expect these feelings to subside?
I'd love to build a network of sober friends who are battling or have defeated an addiction to pain pills.
Has anyone gone through this? Why is this happening at almost 2 months clean?
Is it normal to have anxiety and some headaches at almost 90 days sober?
Anyone else experience anxiety even at 6+ months sober?
Let me know if I can help anyone out struggling, ive been through benzo, opiate, and gabapentin withdrawl and can lend some hope to any that need it.
What to expect? Timeline on things? Times I should take the meds and what not any tips I'm scared of WD.
I'm almost 24 hours in off pure fent from China and it's not treating me well... running from the WD
I wake up throwing up because of the short half life, I'm afraid of it turning out worse than losing my current spot where I'm semi okay
So when I get sober, when do I know what's withdrawal pain and what is my disease pain as I forgot how it is to be sober.
Does anyone have real bad pain with their withdrawal? I wake up in severe pain if I haven't used within 12 hours. How long does this last?
How much and what mg and how many hours in between can I dose this stuff to keep withdrawals bearable for a cold turkey from H?
I'm talking puking and everything so I just went back to what I knew fixed it. ... Went to detox and they did a subutex taper and I started withdrawing 18 hours out.

I'm used to a very noisy life and I never sleep without a tv on. I was in a detox a couple months ago and I stayed the whole time but they also allowed me to bring my phone and I had a tv in my room and wasn't locked up.

Can anyone help me with these questions? I am going to try and switch to suboxone once again and I do not want to go into PDWs. Sometimes I can't wait and it's either take the sub or do heroin, if I do the suboxone and go into percip what can I do instead of using?
So now what, do I wake up and take my suboxone as prescribed when I wake up tomorrow? Will I experience any sickness since the suboxone is in my system and will outlast the dope?

Is it possible to switch from suboxone to heroin for maybe a few months to come off of the suboxone and come off the heroin since it is a shorter withdrawals or has the suboxone already did the damage and when I quit the heroin would withdrawal like I would coming off suboxone.
Im so fucking tired of having to walk on a line with suboxone, anyone know if I can jump from suboxone right onto kratom and get off this shit.
I finally got off of dope using a sub taper. Coming up on 6 months clean from heroin/fent... if you need any help feel free to message me or post on here.

I wish that life was easier, & I could just take some time off without having to worry about money. To think that there are people who can afford to go to recovery resorts, & I am stuck kissing other peoples asses with cold sweats.
This song describes what I feel during WD, in a round-about way. Especially the part where he says "cold as can be".
These past two weeks have probably been the hardest I've ever lived through but I've also never felt stronger.
Over the past month, I couldn't take a damn nap to save my life.
To the people who are just starting out in recovery and attempting to quit, just keep going.
I just looked back on a post I made on r/opiates when I was just about to quit fentanyl and it made me kinda sad, kinda happy. Sad because I'll never forget the pain I was feeling during that time...
I can't imagine being out in the rain or snow and experiencing withdrawal, praying that someone will come through or that you can scrounge up enough money to pick up and not be sick.
If there's anything in this world that will get between me and my sobriety it's this. This shit just might break me.
I did some oxy a day ago before I knew about the test and I wanna know if I'm gonna be tested for it.
I wish you all the best, at one point in time this was my safe haven, but now I must move on with my life and recovery.

With that said I just found out one of my closest friends might have a problem with opiates and that in conjunction with another close friend who I know is going through it all is just breaking my heart.
I've done a few projects around the house, and have my son ready for starting school. When I'm busy I'm sort of OK.
Just wanted to say hello and send you good vibes, at whatever stage in your recovery you are, you're not alone on the journey.
That shit is gonna follow me around all the time, forever, but I have to be able to recognize it and fight it.
I'm a little over a week clean now and I've had withdrawal, but what about *second* withdrawal!? (I didn't relapse, just seemed to go away after a few days and come back wtf)
Seriously, what a pathetic scumbag! I am so grateful that I have no desire to use. I'm finally over the worst of WD and my life is so much better.
You can do it if I could!
Am I the only one? This shit is frustrating.
When everything seems to be falling down though, what do you guys do to keep going? I know I need support right now and i've been trying to tap into all of my resources just to be prepared.
The only thing stopping me from relapsing is my cousin.

column7: I just don't know what to do or how to approach this situation alone and deal with the lack of support. Any thoughts or advice?

verbatim_example: Does anyone have any advice on dealing with life's bullshit as it hits you without falling back into drugs?
I don't know how to tell him to fuck off without being a total bitch.
Anyone else get that in early recovery?
I know I'm never going to get and stay clean unless I figure this shit out first. I know there are a lot things that play into my drug use. But this is my biggest trigger and struggle.
I feel like I'd kill to go get high right now. It's not like it would be hard to make a call and get something... but I'm trying not to.
When he found out I was an addict, he basically told me if I was using he wasn't going to be in my life. He means the world to me. So I decided to give it a shot.

I know it's a stupid thing to let fuck me up but ever since it happened I've been freaking out and all I want to do is get loaded.
Anyone have any advice or knowledge of what level of withdrawals I'll get after this? Will there really be any after only that long?

And inside is some of the best dope I've ever snorted!

I'm here to tell you that it's totally possible.
anyone else have to do this?
i hate whenever i get high on opiates my pupils ALWAYS get super pinned.

So what's up with you bropes? It's been awhile since I've posted in here. How is your dope treating you tonight fellas?!

Just wanted to let anyone that is struggling right now that it does get better as long as you keep doing the next right thing.
The thing that helped me the most is reaching out to other people who were familiar with my situation.
I ran out and need something that will hold me over, but will not show up on a drug test screen...
Also when they pass my desk, they will say "wake up!" or clap there hand loudly. Sometimes i appear sleepy and sometimes i kinda nod, nothing horrible and not every second.
can we see if he lives first? i guess they lost my boyfriend's pulse completely for about 11 seconds before they woke him up and stabilized him.
ive had so many close calls with this shit. the day i learned what pwd was, i had an interview for a promotion. i got the job, but the pwd started as i was being interviewed.
so started out today broke and sick. ended up with almost $200 of free dope
